Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs entered into a conciliation agreement to resolve allegations of hiring discrimination by federal contractors FedEx Ground Package System Inc. and FedEx SmartPost Inc., both subsidiaries of Memphis, Tenn.-based FedEx Corp. The agreement concluded compliance reviews that spanned seven years and numerous FedEx facilities in multiple states.

Private Litigation Case Title: Leighter et al v. FedEx Ground Package System, Inc.
Taylor v. FedEx Freight, Inc.
In re MDL-1700 FedEx Ground Package System Inc Employment Practices Litigation No II
Notes: The settlement covered 20 statewide class action lawsuits alleging that FedEx Ground had improperly designated workers as independent contractors. The document linked here does not cite the aggregate settlement amount but in an SEC filing the company said it had recognized a liability of $204 million. See https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1048911/000095012317006152/fdx-10k_20170531.htm#NOTES_TO_CONSOLIDATED_FINANCIAL_STATEMEN

Private Litigation Case Title: Kolainia Hettick, et al vs Fedex Corporation, et al

Description: Racial and national origin harassment. The trial judge reduced the jury's $61 million award to $12 million.
Private Litigation Case Title: Issa and Rizkallah v. FedEx Ground
Satchell et al v. Fedex Express
Evans v. Fedex Corporation
Alvarado et al v. Fedex Corporation

Description: FedEx agreed to pay $3.15 million to settle cases involving both Fair Credit Reporting Act background check violations and wage & hour violations.
Private Litigation Case Title: Ortiz v. Genco I, Inc. et al

Description: FedEx Ground agreed to pay more than $3 million in settlement of allegations it improperly classified drivers as independent contractors to reduce its payment of payroll taxes, workers' compensation and unemployment benefits.
FedEx Ground agreed to pay $2.3 million in settlement of allegations it failed to pay unemployment insurance for its drivers because it misclassified them as independent contractors.

Private Litigation Case Title: Craig et al v. Fedex Ground Package System Inc.

Description: FedEx Ground Package System, Inc. was cited for violating the Massachusetts Independent Contractor Law by misclassifying its drivers, failing to provide a proper paystub, filing to provide workers' compensation, failing to pay overtime, and neglecting to deduct and withhold state income taxes.

FedEx agreed to pay $35.3 million to settle three lawsuits alleging that it partnered with cigarette trafficking businesses to illegally ship hundreds of thousands of untaxed cigarettes to New Yorkers.
The verdict in this gender discrimination case was upheld by the Sixth Circuit Court of Appeals in 2019.
Private Litigation Case Title: Hubbell v. Fedex Smartpost Inc.

Description: Federal Express Ground Package agreed to pay $1.75 million in settlement of allegations by 16 District Attorneys that it failed to store, transport and dispose of hazardous waste in accordance with California law.

Info Source: FAA waiting for reply from FedEx on proposed fine, Associated Press, August 18, 2000 (via Nexis).

Padovano et al v. Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
